bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit certain employment practices. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. No occupant of a motor vehicle that is stopped on any highway may attempt to hire or hire and pick up passengers for work at a different location if the motor vehicle blocks or impedes the normal movement of traffic. A violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor. Section 2. No person may enter a motor vehicle that is stopped on any highway in order to be hired by an occupant of the motor vehicle and be transported to work at a different location if the motor vehicle blocks or impedes the normal movement of traffic. A violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor. Section 3. No person who is unlawfully present in the United States and who is an unauthorized alien may knowingly apply for work, solicit work in a public place, or perform work as an employee or independent contractor in this state. A violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor. For the purposes of this section, the term, solicit, means verbal or nonverbal communication by a gesture or a nod that would indicate to a reasonable person that a person is willing to be employed. Section 4. No person may transport or move or attempt to transport or move an unauthorized alien in this state in a means of transportation if the person knows or recklessly disregards the fact that the unauthorized alien has come to, has entered, or remains in the United States in violation of law. A violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor. However, any violation of this section that involves ten or more unauthorized aliens is a Class 6 felony. Section 5. No person may conceal, harbor, or shield or attempt to conceal, harbor, or shield an unauthorized alien from detection in any place in this state, including any building or any means of transportation, if the person knows or recklessly disregards the fact that the unauthorized alien has come to, has entered, or remains in the Unites States in violation of law. A violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor. However, any violation of this section that involves ten or more unauthorized aliens is a Class 6 felony. Section 6. No person may encourage or induce an unauthorized alien to come to or reside in this state if the person knows or recklessly disregards the fact that such coming to, entering, or residing in this state is or will be in violation of law. A violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor. However, any violation of this section that involves ten or more unauthorized aliens is a Class 6 felony. Section 7. For the purposes of this Act, the term, unauthorized alien, means an alien who does not have the legal right or authorization under federal law to work in the Unites States as described in 8 U.S.C. § 1324a(h)(3).

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
